definition: To contain something as a part of something else.
example: The report includes several recommendations.
example_translation: Raport zawiera kilka zaleceń.

definition: To make a decision or judgment after considering something.
example: After discussing the issue, they reached a conclusion.
example_translation: Po omówieniu sprawy doszli do wniosku.

definition: To bring something to an end.
example: The meeting concluded at 10 PM.
example_translation: Spotkanie zakończyło się o 22:00.

definition: Specific or special.
example: In this particular case, we need more evidence.
example_translation: W tym szczególnym przypadku potrzebujemy więcej dowodów.

definition: For example.
example: Many birds migrate, for instance, geese and swans.
example_translation: Wiele ptaków migruje, na przykład gęsi i łabędzie.

definition: With the purpose of achieving something.
example: In order to pass the exam, you need to study hard.
example_translation: W celu zdania egzaminu musisz się dużo uczyć.

definition: Taking into account.
example: Considering the circumstances, he did well.
example_translation: Biorąc pod uwagę okoliczności, poradził sobie dobrze.

definition: To be the parts or components of something.
example: These documents constitute the entire agreement.
example_translation: Te dokumenty stanowią całą umowę.

definition: A way of doing something.
example: The best course of action is to consult a lawyer.
example_translation: Najlepszy sposób działania to skonsultować się z prawnikiem.

definition: To be more important than something else.
example: The benefits outweigh the risks.
example_translation: Korzyści przeważają nad ryzykiem.

definition: Disadvantages or negative aspects.
example: Despite its drawbacks, the plan was approved.
example_translation: Pomimo wad plan został zatwierdzony.

definition: Thinking carefully about.
example: Weighing up all the options, they decided to go ahead.
example_translation: Rozważając wszystkie opcje, zdecydowali się kontynuować.

definition: Ideas, opinions or pieces of information that have been presented in relation to the topic.
example: The points raised during the meeting were noted.
example_translation: Poruszone kwestie podczas spotkania zostały zanotowane.

definition: Extremely careful and thorough.
example: The research was conducted in a rigorous manner.
example_translation: Badania przeprowadzono w rygorystyczny sposób.

definition: To reach an answer by thinking carefully about the known facts.
example: From the evidence, we can deduce that he is guilty.
example_translation: Z dowodów możemy dedukować, że jest winny.

definition: Reliable and able to stand up to close examination.
example: The new model is more robust and reliable.
example_translation: Nowy model jest bardziej solidny i niezawodny.

definition: Completely and firmly.
example: The proposal was soundly rejected.
example_translation: Propozycja została solidnie odrzucona.

definition: Considering or remembering something when judging a situation.
example: Taking into account his experience, he was the best candidate.
example_translation: Biorąc pod uwagę jego doświadczenie, był najlepszym kandydatem.

definition: Important parts or features of a problem or situation.
example: We need to focus on the relevant aspects of the case.
example_translation: Musimy skupić się na istotnych aspektach sprawy.

definition: The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
example: The research took two years to complete.
example_translation: Badania zajęły dwa lata.

definition: People of the same age, status, or ability as others in a group.
example: Students were encouraged to discuss their work with their peers.
example_translation: Studentów zachęcano do dyskusji na temat swojej pracy z osobami z tego samego kręgu.

definition: The process of making judgments based on evidence and reasoning.
example: Drawing conclusions from the data was challenging.
example_translation: Wyciąganie wniosków z danych było trudne.

definition: Taking into account.
example: Considering the situation, we should act now.
example_translation: Biorąc pod uwagę sytuację, powinniśmy działać teraz.

definition: To decide firmly in favor of one option or side.
example: After much debate, he came down on one side.
example_translation: Po wielu debatach opowiedział się po jednej stronie.

word: Tip the scales in favor of
definition: To cause a situation to change in favor of someone or something.
example: Her testimony tipped the scales in favor of the defendant.
example_translation: Jej zeznania przechyliły szalę na korzyść oskarżonego.

definition: To indicate or suggest something.
example: All the evidence points to his involvement.
example_translation: Wszystkie dowody wskazują na jego udział.

definition: A state of dissatisfaction, disturbance, and agitation.
example: The political unrest led to widespread protests.
example_translation: Niepokój polityczny doprowadził do powszechnych protestów.

definition: An understanding of the true nature of something.
example: Her insights into the market were invaluable.
example_translation: Jej spostrzeżenia dotyczące rynku były bezcenne.

definition: The people engaged in or available for work.
example: The company is looking to expand its workforce.
example_translation: Firma chce zwiększyć swoją siłę roboczą.

definition: Correctly or satisfactorily.
example: Make sure the equipment is working properly.
example_translation: Upewnij się, że sprzęt działa prawidłowo.

word: Come down on one/be in favor of one/see both sides of an argument

definition: A long essay on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree or diploma.
example: She completed her dissertation on climate change.
example_translation: Ukończyła rozprawę naukową na temat zmiany klimatu.

definition: The available body of facts or information indicating whether a belief or proposition is true or valid.
example: The evidence clearly shows he was guilty.
example_translation: Dowody wyraźnie pokazują, że był winny.

definition: In a way that expresses or involves an analysis of the merits and faults of a work.
example: He critically examined the data.
example_translation: Krytycznie przeanalizował dane.

definition: An evaluation of a work or performance.
example: The critical review of the movie was positive.
example_translation: Krytyczna recenzja filmu była pozytywna.

definition: The expression of disapproval of someone or something based on perceived faults or mistakes.
example: She received a lot of criticism for her decision.
example_translation: Otrzymała wiele krytyki za swoją decyzję.

definition: The objective analysis and evaluation of an issue in order to form a judgment.
example: Critical thinking is essential for problem-solving.
example_translation: Krytyczne myślenie jest niezbędne do rozwiązywania problemów.

definition: Expressing adverse or disapproving comments or judgments.
example: He was highly critical of the new policy.
example_translation: Był bardzo krytyczny wobec nowej polityki.

definition: Discovered, especially something that has been buried or hidden.
example: They unearthed an old manuscript.
example_translation: Odkryli stary rękopis.

definition: Political moods or trends are changing.
example: The political winds are blowing in a different direction now.
example_translation: Polityczne nastroje zmieniają się teraz w innym kierunku.

definition: A large number of protests.
example: The decision sparked a storm of protest.
example_translation: Decyzja wywołała falę protestów.

definition: Researching or looking into historical records.
example: By digging into the archives, they found the original documents.
example_translation: Poprzez badanie archiwów, znaleźli oryginalne dokumenty.

definition: To provide a new or different understanding of a situation.
example: The new evidence sheds new perspective on the case.
example_translation: Nowe dowody rzucają nowe światło na sprawę.
